org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.FileUtils

public class FileUtils
extends Object

The class FileUtils provides utility methods to test different types of documents. Presently the following types of files can be compared 1. Text files where comparision is made line by line for equality 2. Properties files where comparision is made for the existence of same properties and property values

Written:

Copyright (C) 2001, The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR).

All rights reserved.

 $Date: 2005-04-26 12:30:17 -0400 (Tue, 26 Apr 2005) $
 $Author: amahurka $

Author:
Anup Mahurkar

Method Detail

compareTextFiles

public static boolean compareTextFiles(String firstFile,
                                       String secondFile)
                                throws FileNotFoundException,
                                       IOException
The compareTextFiles method compares two text files line by line for the same text.

Parameters:
firstFile - a String value for the first file name
secondFile - a String value for the second file name
Returns:
a boolean value of true if both the files are same
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if one of the specified files does not exist
IOException - if an error occurs reading one of the files

comparePropertiesFiles

public static boolean comparePropertiesFiles(String firstFile,
                                             String secondFile)
                                      throws FileNotFoundException,
                                             IOException
The comparePropertiesFiles method compares two properties files to ensure that the files contain all the properties and that the property values are same. The comparision is done by creating two properties hashes and iterating over the hashes to ensure that the properties are same.

Parameters:
firstFile - a String value for the first file name
secondFile - a String value for the second file name
Returns:
a boolean value of true if both the files are same
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if one of the specified files does not exist
IOException - if an error occurs reading one of the files

compareBCPFiles

public static boolean compareBCPFiles(String firstFile,
                                      String secondFile)
                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                      IOException
The compareBCPFiles method compares two BCP files for the same text. This method assumes that although the data is the same the order may not be the same, so the method first loads the contents of a file entirely in a hash and then reads the second file to see if all the entries in the file exist in the hash and vice versa

Parameters:
firstFile - a String value for the first file name
secondFile - a String value for the second file name
Returns:
a boolean value of true if both the files are same
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if one of the specified files does not exist
IOException - if an error occurs reading one of the files

preloadBuffer

private static StringBuffer preloadBuffer(BufferedReader reader,
                                          StringBuffer buffer,
                                          String terminator)
                                   throws IOException
The preloadBuffer method loads data from the specified reader till the end of line terminator is detected or the end-of-file is reached. This loaded data is appended to the buffer and the buffere returned

Parameters:
reader - a BufferedReader value for the buffered file reader
buffer - a StringBuffer value containng the read data
terminator - a String value for the record terminator string
Returns:
a StringBuffer value containing accumulated data, null if the end of file has reached
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs

compareBCPFiles

public static boolean compareBCPFiles(String firstFile,
                                      String secondFile,
                                      String terminator)
                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                      IOException
The compareBCPFiles method compares two BCP files for the same text with a record terminator that is different than a newline. This method assumes that although the data is the same the order may not be the same, so the method first loads the contents of a file entirely in a hash and then reads the second file to see if all the entries in the file exist in the hash and vice versa

Parameters:
firstFile - a String value for the first file name
secondFile - a String value for the second file name
terminator - a String value for the record terminator
Returns:
a boolean value of true if both the files are same
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if one of the specified files does not exist
IOException - if an error occurs reading one of the files

copyFile

public static void copyFile(String sourceFile,
                            String destFile)
                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                            IOException
The copyFile method copies the specified source file to the specified destination file.

Parameters:
sourceFile - a String value representing the source file name
destFile - a String value representing the destination file name
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if an error occurs opening the source file
IOException - if an error occurs reading or writing files

compareINIFiles

public static boolean compareINIFiles(String firstFile,
                                      String secondFile)
                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                      IOException,
                                      InvalidFileFormatException,
                                      DataFormatErrorException
The method compareINIFiles method compares the contents of the two INI style files to make sure that the files are similar. The method ignores the order in which entries exist, but ensures that all entries and their values exist in both files. This comparison is white space sensitive for the values of each of the keys.

Parameters:
firstFile -
secondFile -
Returns:
a boolean of true if the two files are similar, flase otherwise
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
IOException
InvalidFileFormatException
DataFormatErrorException - a

                 throws FileNotFoundException,
                        IOException
